required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Community Awareness Resources and Education - Project 1

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: To increase early detection of cervical cancer by increasing the proportion of Appalachian women, age 18 and older, who receive Pap smears at appropriate intervals and return for follow-up care when necessary.

detailed_description.textblock: The overall goal of Project 1 is to increase early detection of cervical cancer by increasing the proportion of Appalachian women, age 18 and older, who receive Pap smears at appropriate intervals and return for follow-up care when necessary. The project was implemented in Appalachian Ohio, a mainly rural and underserved area with a population comprised of 1.5 million adults, aged 18 and older, and used community-based participatory research (CBPR) and community relationships already established in the area by Center investigators.

primary_outcome.measure: Receipt of Cervical Cancer screening via Pap Test
primary_outcome.description: the primary outcome of interest for Project 1 intervention will be a dichotomous variable, Pap smear in the past 12-14 months (yes/no). Initially, We will assess the univariate difference between treatment groups (lay health advisor vs. brochure and physician letter) in the proportion of women who received a Pap smear during the past 12 months using design-based logistic regression.

arm_group.description: All women over age 18 encouraged to obtain Pap smears appropriate for their risk profile, the comparison arm included a low-literacy brochure to encourage women to receive screening. The brochure was designed to answer basic questions about Pap smears and provide instructions on how to obtain a Pap smear.

The Lay Health Advisor education intervention - The intervention consisted of an intensive, reinforced, one on one, interactive ed. program (an initial meeting, then 2 calls and a series of 4 postcards mailed at regular intervals and a 2nd visit. Woman were enrolled for about 12 to 14 months.

intervention.description: The individualized health education intervention consisted of an intensive, reinforced, face to face, interactive educational program. The program included an initial meeting of 45 60 minutes, followed by two telephone calls and reinforcement by a series of four postcards mailed at regular intervals and a second visit. Each woman will be enrolled in the intervention program for approximately 12 to 14 months.

All women over age 18 encouraged to obtain Pap smears appropriate for their risk profile, the comparison arm included a low-literacy brochure to encourage women to receive screening. The brochure was designed to answer basic questions about Pap smears and provide instructions on how to obtain a Pap smear.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women age 18 and older
- who have visited participating clinics during the last two years and
- who consider themselves to be a current patient of that clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not a resident of the selected Ohio Appalachia county
- Under the age of 18

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center
